intro: Orthocarpus densiflorus, commonly known as the denseflower orthocarpus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, spicy scent. Orthocarpus densiflorus is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
